title: Run the singleton lease+queue integrator in shadow mode so orchestration behavior is validated without allowing canonical `main` merges.

five_acts.act_1_context: Integration needed a safe validation path that exercised lease ownership, durable queue ordering, readiness rechecks, and main-clearance coordination without touching canonical main.
five_acts.act_2_build: Implemented a dedicated integration core package with file-backed lease state, durable queue state transitions, and a shadow runtime that emits would_integrate or would_block outcomes.
five_acts.act_3_conflict: Review rounds surfaced correctness and resilience gaps in self-blocking clearance logic, transition rules, constructor validation, and edge-case test coverage.
five_acts.act_4_resolution: Fix rounds added owner-session exclusion, stricter transition checks, constructor guards, and targeted regression tests until review reached APPROVE.
five_acts.act_5_outcome: The branch now provides deterministic shadow-mode integration orchestration with lease/queue safety gates and review-validated behavior, ready for non-shadow cutover hardening.
